Instrat growled.

Instrat: What right do you have to harm wildlife!?

Instrat lunged at Carnage and swung the scythe at her head...

----- Original Message -----
From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 21, 2000 3:15 PM
Subject: Re: Wanderings & a new friend


> ( Carnage: I try. :) )
>
> ** Carnage had heard someone come up behind her as she tore through the
sow,
> the blood of the convulsing flesh pouring out the gaps between one tooth
to
> the other.
> The dead pig was still warm and slightly alive, but shock had set in and
it
> felt nothing of the carnage she was inflicting upon it.
> There was someone near her.
> Suddenly she heard a voice behind her, snapping her head around, teeth
pared
> and a quarter of the pigs flesh dangling from her jaws.
>
> Carnage had just enough time to see the scythe slash down before she
jerked
> her body up, the blade catching her in the shoulder and sinking deeply.
> She roared at the sudden flush of pain, but still in the lock of the hunt,
> she wasn';t going to stand for anyone stealing her kill!
> Carnage brought her neck around and opened her jaws, snapping them towards
> the face of Instrat. Her jaws snapping shut inches away from the bots
face,
> then yanking her shoulder free of the wicked blade.
> The moved her body so that she could strike out again, bunching up her leg
> muscles but remaining in her spot.**
>
> " Bots have to eat too!"
>
> ** she roared, but then cocked her head to the side and looked at the bot
> again, her shoulder burning.**
>
> " Who are you? And what right do you have attacking me like that?"
>
> ** the pig at her feet twitched a bit, making sick liquid squeels.
> Carnage raised her hind leg and simply set it over the pigs throat,
bringing
> her hind claw down quickly shutting it up.
> If this bot left her alone then she just might get to kill the thing and
end
> it's misserly. It wasn't right to let it suffer.
> But...then Carnage remembered the boar by the tree that she still had to
> finish, as well as the little headless pig to pick up.
> She eyed the bot for a sec before before leaning down and collecting the
sow
> in her mouth, the pig too big to simply pick up.
> Backing a step she growled towards the one who attacked her with the
scyth,
> sinking her teeth into the sow a bit more.
> Continuing to move back towards the direction where the boar still lat
> squeeling.**
>
>
>
>
>
